LIRR Cannonball Express Service to Hamptons

The LIRR asks customers on the "Cannonball" express train from Penn Station to the Hamptons & Montauk to leave oversized luggage at home and stow all items under seats and in overhead racks to help ensure a safe and comfortable ride.

In addition to LIRR's express Cannonball train to Hamptons, other alternative LIRR Hamptons-Montauk service on Fridays include: - 1:42PM from Penn; (change at Jamaica); arrives Montauk 4:45PM - 4:19PM from Penn; (change at Jamaica); arrives Montauk 7:34PM - 5:09PM from Penn; arrives Montauk 8:29PM - 5:51PM from Penn; (change at Jamaica); arrives Montauk 9:07PM - 7:11PM from Penn; (change at Jamaica); arrives Montauk 10:10PM - 8:30PM from Penn; (change at Jamaica); arrives Montauk 11:57PM For details see LIRR Montauk Branch Timetable http://web.mta.info/lirr/Timetable/Branch2/MontaukBranch.pdf

Cannonball customers avoid the lines, download the free MTA eTix app and buy LIRR tickets right on your phone. MTA eTix is available now for travel to all LIRR stations - visit mta.info/etix for more info on LIRR mobile ticketing.

LIRR Cannonball Express Service to Hamptons

The Cannonball, the LIRR's non-stop express train to the Hamptons operates today, departing Penn Station at 4:06 PM. All luggage MUST fit in the overhead rack or under the seat. Luggage MUST not block aisles or doors. Please listen to announcements or check departure boards for final track assignment. Hamptons Reserve customers on the Cannonball please board on the first three cars of the train. If departing from Track 19, use the staircase to the left of the last LIRR ticket window. See map at http://web.mta.info/lirr/hamptons/HamptonsReservePennMap.jpg

QMT: MANHATTAN EXIT PLAZA CLOSURE OF "DOWNTOWN" LANES FOR THREE MONTHS

QMT: MANHATTAN EXIT PLAZA CLOSURE OF "DOWNTOWN" LANES FOR THREE MONTHS For approximately three months, the two right "Downtown" exit lanes at the Manhattan plaza of the Queens Midtown Tunnel will be closed for the final stage of exit plaza roadway rehabilitation. Customers traveling Downtown can use the four open and newly resurfaced "Uptown" or "Crosstown" exit lanes, or the left "Downtown" exit lane, which will remain open during this period. In addition, East 37th Street between Tunnel Exit and 2nd Avenue has been temporarily converted to receive two-way traffic, to accommodate motorists exiting the tunnel from the Uptown lanes and seeking a Downtown route via 2nd Avenue.

For Wednesday morning, May 24, Metro-North will operate regular New Haven Line service. Because of continuing track repairs in the vicinity of Rye, customers traveling between Greenwich and Rye to Grand Central will need to use the outbound (to New Haven) platform and customers traveling to New Haven will need to use the inbound (to Grand Central) platform during the AM Peak thru 10 AM. Customers should anticipate delays of 10-15 minutes. Please listen for announcements at your station. Bridge plates are being used on the inbound platforms between Greenwich and Rye stations. Please use caution and do not wait on the bridge plate for your train.

For Tuesday morning, May 23, Metro-North will operate regular New Haven Line service. Because of continuing track repairs in the vicinity of Rye, customers traveling between Greenwich and Rye to Grand Central will need to use the outbound (to New Haven) platform and customers traveling to New Haven will need to use the inbound (to Grand Central) platform during the AM Peak thru 10 AM. Customers should anticipate delays of 10-15 minutes. Please listen for announcements at your station. Bridge plates are being used on the inbound platforms between Greenwich and Rye stations. Please use caution and do not wait on the bridge plate for your train.

Busing will end early morning Monday, with the 12:10 AM train departing Grand Central Terminal to Dover Plains. See the schedule at http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Wassaic_bus511_Layout_1.pdf Thank you for your cooperation during these track improvements. Buses will operate 15-30 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Please listen for announcements and check local or express bus service to your destination when boarding.
Danbury Branch Substitute Busing, Friday, May 19, all Sat. & Sun. May 20-21

Substitute bus service will be provided between Danbury and South Norwalk beginning with select trains on Friday, May 19, and all Saturday and Sunday, May 20 - 21. On Friday, busing will start with the 8:01 PM train departing Grand Central Terminal. Busing will end early Monday morning with the 11:26 PM departing Grand Central Terminal for Danbury. See the schedule at http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/DanburyBusing51217.pdf Thank you for your cooperation while we make grade crossing and infrastructure improvements at the Catherine Street crossing. Buses will operate approximately 15 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Listen for announcements and check local or express bus service to your destination when boarding.

Yankees Train to the Game Sun., May 14 to Accommodate Double-Header

With the cancellation of Saturday, May 13 Yankee Game and because on Sunday, May 14, the Yankees are offering a single-admission double-header, Metro-North will be offering additional train service on Sunday, May 14. This schedule will accommodate passengers traveling to the 2:05 PM game, the Derek Jeter ceremony which starts at 6:35 PM, and the second game which starts at 7:35 PM. On the Harlem Line, train 7622 (11:05 AM from Southeast) will operate. On the New Haven Line, train 7527 (10:14 AM from New Haven) will operate. All Hudson Line trains will make a Yankees-E. 153rd Street stop beginning at 11 AM and until 10 PM. For Customers traveling to the 2 PM game we will be operating a 1 PM weekend game schedule. In addition regular weekend shuttle service to Yankee Stadium to and from Grand Central Terminal will operate on a normal weekend schedule. Customers wishing to use post-game service must use the Shuttle between Grand Central Terminal/ Harlem and Yankees E. 153rd St. Station. For the second 7:35 PM game, customers can consult the regular weekend 7 PM game service. Customers can also consult our TrainTime app at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm which will reflect the schedule changes listed above. Please also consult our Yankees' Train to the Game Schedules page for regular Yankee game service times, http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/yankees/yankee_service.htm

Yankees Train to the Game Sun., May 14 to Accommodate Double-Header

With the cancellation of Saturday, May 13 Yankee Game and because on Sunday, May 14, the Yankees are offering a single-admission double-header, Metro-North will be offering additional train service on Sunday, May 14. This schedule will accommodate passengers traveling to the 2:05 PM game, the Derek Jeter ceremony which starts at 6:35 PM, and the second game which starts at 7:35 PM. On the Harlem Line, train 7622 (11:05 AM from Southeast) will operate. On the New Haven Line, train 7527 (10:14 AM from New Haven) will operate. All Hudson Line trains will make a Yankees-E. 153rd Street stop beginning at 11 AM and until 10 PM. For Customers traveling to the 2 PM game we will be operating a 1 PM weekend game schedule. In addition regular weekend shuttle service to Yankee Stadium to and from Grand Central Terminal will operate on a normal weekend schedule. Customers wishing to use post-game service must use the Shuttle between Grand Central Terminal/ Harlem and Yankees E. 153rd St. Station. For the second 7:35 PM game, customers can consult the regular weekend 7 PM game service. Customers can also consult our TrainTime app at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm which will reflect the schedule changes listed above. Please also consult our Yankees' Train to the Game Schedules page for regular Yankee game service times, http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/yankees/yankee_service.htm
